This occurred the day after the fall of Damascus, following the collapse of military positions and the resulting paralysis of all remaining state institutions.-

Description: Forwarded From ShamSğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ Strategic Context of Israeli StrikesThese attacks come amid a volatile period in Syria following the abrupt collapse of Assadâ€™s regime. Analysts suggest the strikes are part of a broader Israeli strategy to neutralize military capabilities in Syria as the country transitions to new leadership.Ashraf Akka, an expert in international relations, explained that the airstrikes appear designed to -deny the nascent governing authorities in Syria any military leverage, including advanced weaponry or infrastructure that could shift regional power dynamics.-The port of Latakia is a critical hub for Syrian and allied forces. It has frequently been used to transport military equipment from Iran, a close ally of Assadâ€™s regime, to Syria and Hezbollah forces in Lebanon. Its targeting underscores Israelâ€™s ongoing concerns about Iranâ€™s entrenchment in Syria and the potential transfer of advanced weaponry to hostile groups.The Yaâ€™four and Damascus sites, central to Syriaâ€™s former military elite, hold symbolic and strategic importance. The strikes on these locations signal Israelâ€™s intent to dismantle remnants of the Assad regimeâ€™s military infrastructure.Israel has carried out hundreds of airstrikes in Syria over the years, targeting Iranian and Hezbollah forces. These actions are part of what Israel refers to as its -campaign between wars- strategy, aimed at weakening its adversaries without provoking a full-scale conflict.The recent strikes come at a pivotal moment for Syria as the country grapples with political instability and security vacuums. Israel has not officially commented on the latest operations, in line with its policy of ambiguity regarding military actions in Syria.The escalation highlights the fragility of the post-Assad landscape in Syria. Title: ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾âš¡ï¸- The Syrian National Transitional Government has released ...
Description: ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾âš¡ï¸- The Syrian National Transitional Government has released its first statement since the fall of the Assad government.-O free sons of Syria,After long years of injustice, tyranny and oppression, and after great sacrifices made by the sons and daughters of this dear homeland, we announce today to the great Syrian people and the entire world that the regime of Bashar al-Assad has fallen, and that he has fled the country, leaving behind a legacy of destruction and suffering.On this historic day, we announce that the forces of the revolution and opposition have taken control of affairs in beloved Syria, and we affirm our commitment to building a free, just and democratic state in which all citizens are equal without discrimination.We pledge before God and before the people the following:1. Preserving the unity and sovereignty of Syrian territory.2. Protecting all citizens and their property, regardless of their affiliations.3. Working to rebuild the state and its institutions on the foundations of freedom and justice.4. Striving to achieve comprehensive national reconciliation, and returning refugees and displaced persons to their homes in safety and dignity.5. Holding accountable all those who have committed crimes against the Syrian people, in accordance with the law and justice.We call on all the Syrian people to unite and stand together at this historic stage, and we affirm that the new Syria will not be the monopoly of anyone, but rather a homeland for all.Long live a free and proud Syria,And peace, mercy and blessings of God be upon you.-National Transitional CouncilDamascus, 12/08/2024.

Title: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸âš¡ï¸- The US Supreme Court has begun arguments today on what is...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸âš¡ï¸- The US Supreme Court has begun arguments today on what is expected to be a landmark decision on transgenderism in United States v. Skrmetti. The case is over Tennessee's ban on trans surgery for minors which was passed after heavy lobbying by Matt Walsh and conservative activists.The ACLU and the Biden Administration are arguing the ban violates the 14th Amendment. The ACLU lawyer, a trans named Chase Strangio is the first trans person to ever argue in front of the Supreme Court.In 2020 the last time a trans rights case was before the Court, they ruled 6-3 in favor of the ACLU agreeing that Civil Rights protections in hiring practices applied to transgenders.So far this morning the Conservative Justices are more reserved in their questioning of Strangio while the Liberal Justices Sotomayor, Jackson, and Kagan are bouncing off each other in heavily attacking Mathew Rice, the lawyer arguing in favor of Tennessee's law. Rice is holding his ground against them refusing to give up Tennessee's arguments.

Those who follow the Russia-Ukraine conflict would already be aware, it's notorious for fabricating claims, and does so on purpose. It's a very unreliable source.For instance, on its current map, it has Russia at Borova gates. A vital city on the Oskol river. These are advances not even Russia claims. They are painted red, then a week or so later, a made-up Ukrainian counterattack repels Russia to the actual front-lines. Of course, there was no counterattack, as Russian forces weren't even there. In this way it makes it seem Ukraine is re-gaining territory.
